00037 /**
00038  *  Produce ccnd debug output.
00039  *  Output is produced via h->logger under the control of h->debug;
00040  *  prepends decimal timestamp and process identification.
00041  *  Caller should not supply newlines.
00042  *  @param      h  the ccnd handle
00043  *  @param      fmt  printf-like format string
00044  */
00045 void
00046 ccnd_msg(struct ccnd_handle *h, const char *fmt, ...)
00047 {
00048     struct timeval t;
00049     va_list ap;
00050     struct ccn_charbuf *b;
00051     int res;
00052     time_t clock;
00053     if (h == NULL || h->debug == 0 || h->logger == 0)
00054         return;
00055     b = ccn_charbuf_create();
00056     gettimeofday(&t, NULL);
00057     if (((h->debug & 64) != 0) &&
00058         ((h->logbreak-- < 0 && t.tv_sec != h->logtime) ||
00059           t.tv_sec >= h->logtime + 30)) {
00060         clock = t.tv_sec;
00061         ccn_charbuf_putf(b, "%ld.000000 ccnd[%d]: %s ____________________ %s",
00062                          (long)t.tv_sec, h->logpid,
00063                          h->portstr ? h->portstr : "",
00064                          ctime(&clock));
00065         h->logtime = t.tv_sec;
00066         h->logbreak = 30;
00067     }
00068     ccn_charbuf_putf(b, "%ld.%06u ", (long)t.tv_sec, (unsigned)t.tv_usec);
00069     if (h->debug & 32)
00070         ccn_charbuf_putf(b, "%08x.", (unsigned)h->wtnow);
00071     ccn_charbuf_putf(b, "ccnd[%d]: %s\n", h->logpid, fmt);
00072     va_start(ap, fmt);
00073     res = (*h->logger)(h->loggerdata, (const char *)b->buf, ap);
00074     va_end(ap);
00075     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&b);
00076     /* if there's no one to hear, don't make a sound */
00077     if (res < 0)
00078         h->debug = 0;
00079 }
00080 
00081 /**
00082  *  Construct a printable representation of an Interest's excludes,
00083  *  and append it to the supplied ccn_charbuf.
00084  *  @param      c   pointer to the charbuf to append to
00085  *  @param      ccnb    pointer to ccnb-encoded Interest
00086  *  @param      pi  pointer to the parsed interest data
00087  *  @param      limit   number of components to print before ending with " .."
00088  */
00089 void
00090 ccnd_append_excludes(struct ccn_charbuf *c,
00091                      const unsigned char *ccnb,
00092                      struct ccn_parsed_interest *pi,
00093                      int limit)
00094 {
00095     struct ccn_buf_decoder decoder;
00096     struct ccn_buf_decoder *d;
00097     const unsigned char *bloom;
00098     size_t bloom_size = 0;
00099     const unsigned char *comp;
00100     size_t comp_size;
00101     int sep = 0;
00102     int l = pi->offset[CCN_PI_E_Exclude] - pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude];
00103     
00104     if (l <= 0) return;
00105     
00106     d = ccn_buf_decoder_start(&decoder, ccnb + pi->offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude], l);
00107     if (!ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Exclude)) return;
00108 
00109     ccn_buf_advance(d);
00110     if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Any)) {
00111         ccn_buf_advance(d);
00112         ccn_charbuf_append_string(c, "*");
00113         ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00114         sep = 1;
00115     }
00116     else if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Bloom)) {
00117         ccn_buf_advance(d);
00118         if (ccn_buf_match_blob(d, &bloom, &bloom_size))
00119             ccn_buf_advance(d);
00120         ccn_charbuf_append_string(c, "?");
00121         ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00122         sep = 1;
00123     }
00124     while (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Component)) {
00125         if (sep) ccn_charbuf_append_string(c, ",");
00126         if (0 == limit--) {
00127             ccn_charbuf_append_string(c, " ..");
00128             return;
00129         }
00130         ccn_buf_advance(d);
00131         comp_size = 0;
00132         if (ccn_buf_match_blob(d, &comp, &comp_size))
00133             ccn_buf_advance(d);
00134         if ((CCN_URI_DEFAULT_ESCAPE & CCN_URI_MIXEDESCAPE) != 0)
00135             ccn_uri_append_mixedescaped(c, comp, comp_size);
00136         else
00137             ccn_uri_append_percentescaped(c, comp, comp_size);
00138         ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00139         if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Any)) {
00140             ccn_buf_advance(d);
00141             ccn_charbuf_append_string(c, ",*");
00142             ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00143         }
00144         else if (ccn_buf_match_dtag(d, CCN_DTAG_Bloom)) {
00145             ccn_buf_advance(d);
00146             if (ccn_buf_match_blob(d, &bloom, &bloom_size))
00147                 ccn_buf_advance(d);
00148             ccn_charbuf_append_string(c, ",?");
00149             ccn_buf_check_close(d);
00150         }
00151         sep = 1;
00152     }
00153 }
00154 
00155 /**
00156  *  Produce a ccnd debug trace entry.
00157  *  Output is produced by calling ccnd_msg.
00158  *  @param      h  the ccnd handle
00159  *  @param      lineno  caller's source line number (usually __LINE__)
00160  *  @param      msg  a short text tag to identify the entry
00161  *  @param      face    handle of associated face; may be NULL
00162  *  @param      ccnb    points to ccnb-encoded Interest or ContentObject
00163  *  @param      ccnb_size   is in bytes
00164  */
00165 void
00166 ccnd_debug_ccnb(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00167                 int lineno,
00168                 const char *msg,
00169                 struct face *face,
00170                 const unsigned char *ccnb,
00171                 size_t ccnb_size)
00172 {
00173     struct ccn_charbuf *c;
00174     struct ccn_parsed_interest pi = {
00175         0
00176     };
00177     const unsigned char *nonce = NULL;
00178     size_t nonce_size = 0;
00179     const unsigned char *pubkey = NULL;
00180     size_t pubkey_size = 0;
00181     size_t i;
00182     size_t sim_hash = 0;
00183     struct interest_entry *ie = NULL;
00184     int default_lifetime = CCN_INTEREST_LIFETIME_SEC << 12;
00185     intmax_t lifetime = default_lifetime;
00186     
00187     if (h != NULL && h->debug == 0)
00188         return;
00189     if (ccn_parse_interest(ccnb, ccnb_size, &pi, NULL) >= 0) {
00190         pubkey_size = (pi.offset[CCN_PI_E_PublisherIDKeyDigest] -
00191                        pi.offset[CCN_PI_B_PublisherIDKeyDigest]);
00192         pubkey = ccnb + pi.offset[CCN_PI_B_PublisherIDKeyDigest];
00193         lifetime = ccn_interest_lifetime(ccnb, &pi);
00194         ccn_ref_tagged_BLOB(CCN_DTAG_Nonce, ccnb,
00195                   pi.offset[CCN_PI_B_Nonce],
00196                   pi.offset[CCN_PI_E_Nonce],
00197                   &nonce,
00198                   &nonce_size);
00199         ie = hashtb_lookup(h->interest_tab, ccnb, pi.offset[CCN_PI_B_Nonce]);
00200         sim_hash = hashtb_hash(ccnb, pi.offset[CCN_PI_B_InterestLifetime]);
00201     }
00202     else {
00203         pi.min_suffix_comps = 0;
00204         pi.max_suffix_comps = 32767;
00205         pi.orderpref = 0;
00206         pi.answerfrom = CCN_AOK_DEFAULT;
00207         pi.scope = -1;
00208     }
00209     c = ccn_charbuf_create();
00210     ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "debug.%d %s ", lineno, msg);
00211     if (face != NULL)
00212         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "%u ", face->faceid);
00213     ccn_uri_append(c, ccnb, ccnb_size, 1);
00214     ccn_charbuf_putf(c, " (%u bytes", (unsigned)ccnb_size);
00215     if (pi.min_suffix_comps != 0 || pi.max_suffix_comps != 32767) {
00216         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ",c=%d", pi.min_suffix_comps);
00217         if (pi.min_suffix_comps != pi.max_suffix_comps) {
00218             ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ":");
00219             if (pi.max_suffix_comps != 32767)
00220                 ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "%d", pi.max_suffix_comps);
00221         }
00222     }
00223     if (pubkey_size >= 3)
00224         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ",pb=%02X%02X%02X",
00225                          pubkey[0], pubkey[1], pubkey[2]);
00226     if (pi.orderpref != 0)
00227         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ",cs=%d", pi.orderpref);
00228     if (pi.answerfrom != CCN_AOK_DEFAULT)
00229         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ",aok=%#x", pi.answerfrom);
00230     if (pi.scope != -1)
00231         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ",scope=%d", pi.scope);
00232     if (lifetime != default_lifetime) {
00233         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ",life=%d.%04d",
00234                          (int)(lifetime >> 12),
00235                          (int)(lifetime & 0xFFF) * 10000 / 4096);
00236     }
00237     if (ie != NULL)
00238         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ",i=%u", ie->serial);
00239     if (sim_hash != 0)
00240         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ",sim=%08X", (unsigned)sim_hash);
00241     if (pi.offset[CCN_PI_E_Exclude] - pi.offset[CCN_PI_B_Exclude] > 0) {
00242         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ",e=[");
00243         ccnd_append_excludes(c, ccnb, &pi, h->debug & 16 ? -1 : 7);
00244         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "]");
00245     }
00246     ccn_charbuf_putf(c, ")");
00247     if (nonce_size > 0) {
00248         const char *p = "";
00249         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, " ");
00250         if (nonce_size == 12)
00251             p = "CCC-P-F-T-NN";
00252         for (i = 0; i < nonce_size; i++)
00253             ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "%s%02X", (*p) && (*p++)=='-' ? "-" : "", nonce[i]);
00254     }
00255     ccnd_msg(h, "%s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(c));
00256     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00257 }
00258 
00259 /**
00260  *  Produce a ccnd debug trace entry for content
00261  *  
00262  *  This takes a content handle so that we can print the already-computed
00263  *  implicit digest.
00264  */
00265 void
00266 ccnd_debug_content(struct ccnd_handle *h,
00267                    int lineno,
00268                    const char *msg,
00269                    struct face *face,
00270                    struct content_entry *content)
00271 {
00272     struct ccny *y = NULL;
00273     struct ccn_charbuf *c;
00274     
00275     y = ccny_from_cookie(h->content_tree, content->accession);
00276     if (y == NULL) return;
00277     c = ccn_charbuf_create();
00278     if (c == NULL) return;
00279     ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "debug.%d %s ", lineno, msg);
00280     if (face != NULL)
00281         ccn_charbuf_putf(c, "%u ", face->faceid);
00282     ccn_uri_append_flatname(c, ccny_key(y), ccny_keylen(y), 1);
00283     ccn_charbuf_putf(c, " (%u bytes)", (unsigned)content->size);
00284     ccnd_msg(h, "%s", ccn_charbuf_as_string(c));
00285     ccn_charbuf_destroy(&c);
00286 }

00288 /**
00289  * CCND Usage message
00290  */
00291 const char *ccnd_usage_message =
00292     "ccnd - CCNx Daemon\n"
00293     "  options: none\n"
00294     "  arguments: none\n"
00295     "  environment variables:\n"
00296     "    CCND_DEBUG=\n"
00297     "      0 - no messages\n"
00298     "      1 - basic messages (any non-zero value gets these)\n"
00299     "      2 - interest messages\n"
00300     "      4 - content messages\n"
00301     "      8 - matching details\n"
00302     "      16 - interest details\n"
00303     "      32 - gory interest details\n"
00304     "      64 - log occasional human-readable timestamps\n"
00305     "      128 - face registration debugging\n"
00306     "      bitwise OR these together for combinations; -1 gets max logging\n"
00307     "    CCN_LOCAL_PORT=\n"
00308     "      UDP port for unicast clients (default "CCN_DEFAULT_UNICAST_PORT").\n"
00309     "      Also listens on this TCP port for stream connections.\n"
00310     "      Also affects name of unix-domain socket.\n"
00311     "    CCN_LOCAL_SOCKNAME=\n"
00312     "      Name stem of unix-domain socket (default "CCN_DEFAULT_LOCAL_SOCKNAME").\n"
00313     "    CCND_CAP=\n"
00314     "      Capacity limit, in count of ContentObjects.\n"
00315     "      Not an absolute limit.\n"
00316     "    CCND_MTU=\n"
00317     "      Packet size in bytes.\n"
00318     "      If set, interest stuffing is allowed within this budget.\n"
00319     "      Single items larger than this are not precluded.\n"
00320     "    CCND_DATA_PAUSE_MICROSEC=\n"
00321     "      Adjusts content-send delay time for multicast and udplink faces\n"
00322     "    CCND_DEFAULT_TIME_TO_STALE=\n"
00323     "      Default for content objects without explicit FreshnessSeconds\n"
00324     "    CCND_MAX_TIME_TO_STALE=\n"
00325     "      Limit, in seconds, until content becomes stale\n"
00326     "    CCND_MAX_RTE_MICROSEC=\n"
00327     "      Value used to limit response time estimates kept by default strategy.\n"
00328     "    CCND_KEYSTORE_DIRECTORY=\n"
00329     "      Directory readable only by ccnd where its keystores are kept\n"
00330     "      Defaults to a private subdirectory of /var/tmp\n"
00331     "    CCND_LISTEN_ON=\n"
00332     "      List of ip addresses to listen on; defaults to wildcard\n"
00333     "    CCND_AUTOREG=\n"
00334     "      List of prefixes to auto-register on new faces initiated by peers\n"
00335     "      example: CCND_AUTOREG=ccnx:/like/this,ccnx:/and/this\n"
00336     "    CCND_PREFIX=\n"
00337     "      A prefix stem to use for generating guest prefixes\n"
00338     ;
